intro: Protium yanachagae, commonly known as the Yanachaga protium, is a tropical tree native to the Amazon rainforest of Peru. It belongs to the family Burseraceae, which includes species known for their aromatic resins. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its fruits are woody capsules that split open to release seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Protium yanachagae is considered a rare and ecologically significant species within its native range.
